entities.description: A concrete character in the story (human or anthropomorphized object).

An occurrence in the narrative world that can be described as 'who did what to whom/what, when and where, leading to what result'. Events can be **actions (e.g., attack, movement, dialogue)** or **state changes (e.g., death, birth, disappearance, arrival, transformation)**. Events must be content-centered; narrative devices such as montage, narration/voice-over, subtitles, or camera switches must not be treated as events. Each event should map to at least one specific action or state change; if a montage contains multiple concurrent actions, they should be split into atomic events rather than named 'montage start'.

properties.name: Event title
properties.description: A complete sentence describing what happened
properties.cause: Cause of the event, describing what triggered or led to it
properties.process: Process of the event, describing main steps or key developments
properties.result: Outcome of the event, describing its consequences or impact

entities.description: A specific unit of action performed by a character or object; can be part of an Event.

properties.description: Complete description of the action (e.g., someone raises a gun to aim)

entities.description: A specific time point or period.
An item or device that plays a role in the story.
Abstract or collective entities such as organizations, factions, ideologies, or identity categories.
Emotional or psychological states expressed by characters in the narrative.

character_relations.description: Affiliated with an organization or faction (Character → Concept)

event_action_relations.description: Participates in an event (Character / Object → Event)
An event is composed of multiple actions (Event → Action)
Temporal or narrative precedence (Event / Action → Event / Action)
Direct causal trigger (Event / Action → Event / Action)
Event or action affects a character/object (Event / Action → Character / Object)

object_relations.description: Possession of an object (Character / Concept → Object)
Use or manipulation of an object (Character / Object → Object)

semantic_relations.description: An action or sub-event belongs to a larger event (Action / Event → Event)
Entity belongs to an abstract concept or category (Any → Concept)
Compositional/hierarchical relationship (Location / Object / Action → Location / Object)
A character experiences an emotion (Character → Emotion)

spatiotemporal_relations.description: Event/action occurs at a location (Event / Action → Location)
Event/action occurs at a time point or period (Event / Action → TimePoint)
Character or object is located/appears at a location (Character / Object → Location)
Character or object is present at a specific time point or period (Character / Object → TimePoint)
